ud6.5:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud6.5:1.3: Now at that time several ascetics, brahmins, and wanderers who followed various other paths were residing in Sāvatthī, holding different views and opinions, relying on different views.
ud6.5:2.1: There were some ascetics and brahmins who had this doctrine and view:
ud6.5:2.2: “The self and the cosmos are eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.”
ud6.5:3.1: Others held views such as the following, each regarding their own view as true and others as silly.
ud6.5:3.2: “The self and the cosmos are not eternal.”
ud6.5:4.2: “The self and the cosmos are both eternal and not eternal.”
ud6.5:5.2: “The self and the cosmos are neither eternal nor not eternal.”
ud6.5:6.2: “The self and the cosmos are made by oneself.”
ud6.5:7.2: “The self and the cosmos are made by another.”
